A platform that tracks and rewards eco-friendly behavior can:

  • Encourage residents to plant more trees and conserve resources.
  • Create a culture of sustainability within housing societies.
  • Provide data-driven insights to building committees.
  • Offer recognition and incentives to top contributors.

Measurable outcomes:

  • 500+ plants donated in the first 3 months.
  • 20% reduction in electricity and water usage across participating homes.
  • Increased community participation in green initiatives.
  • Enhanced resident satisfaction and committee engagement.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: In urban societies, environmental efforts like planting trees, saving electricity, and conserving water often go unnoticed and unappreciated. Residents lack motivation to adopt eco-friendly habits due to the absence of recognition or incentives. Building committees also struggle to track and reward such contributions effectively.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • Service Portal – for resident registration, logging plant donations, and viewing rankings
  • Record Producer – to collect user details and eco-friendly activity logs
  • Flow Designer – to automate weekly ranking calculations and notifications
  • Virtual Agent – for eco-tips, guidance, and engagement
  • Notification Engine – to alert users about their rank, offers, and weekly updates
  • Performance Analytics – to track contributions, resource usage, and community impact
  • IntegrationHub – for optional integration with smart meters or utility APIs
  • Survey Management – for collecting feedback and improving the platform
  • Now Mobile (optional) – for mobile logging and updates

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Integration with smart meters or utility APIs for electricity/water usage tracking
  • Secure handling of resident data and activity logs
  • Notification system for real-time updates and recognition
  • Dynamic ranking logic based on multiple eco-metrics
  • Optional integration with committee billing systems for applying discounts

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Ensuring accurate and fair tracking of eco-friendly activities
  • Encouraging consistent participation from residents
  • Managing data privacy and secure access
  • Coordinating with building committees for incentives and billing adjustments
  • Scaling the platform across multiple societies or regions
